author: gumb00
content:
some observations about

> 5. Charge the sender PER_EMPTY_ACCOUNT_COST if authority does not exist in the trie. Abort immediately if the sender balance is less than this value.

1. I think you meant `PER_EMPTY_ACCOUNT_COST * effective_gas_price` 

2. Authorizations are not rolled back for aborted transaction, so abort in this case also wouldn't roll back previous authorizations in the list (I guess it's fine or at least consistent)

3. This changes the guarantee that valid transactions will not fail with not enough sender balance - i.e. extra balance check is required when transferring value

author: gumb00
content:
> If a code reading instruction accesses a cold account during the resolution of delegated code, assess an additional [EIP-2929](eip-2929.md) `COLD_ACCOUNT_READ` cost of `2600` gas to the normal cost.

I think it should be extra `100` if delegated code was warm, `2600` if cold
